Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey-black in section, the interior is slightly ribbed and bears traces of five lines of black-painted demotic text, the exterior is elaborated with painted decoration comprising red-brown and cream-coloured zones, separated by a blue-black line, remains of seven lines of black-painted demotic text also survive. Join to EA 66255.
Curator's comments: Joins EA 66255 Cemeteries and Osireion Excavations Group
Bibliographic references: Frankfort 1933 / The Cenotaph of Seti I at Abydos (no.11, p.95)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (51803) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/51803)
Almásy-Martin 2020 / Demotic, Greek and Coptic ostraca from Abydos in the British Museum (no.9)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.BM Abydos Dem. 9 (Edition abbreviation according to Oates et al. 2001)
